head.title: Treasury Bills Scheduled for This Week

hedline.hl1: Treasury Bills Scheduled for This Week

block.p: The Treasury's schedule of financing this week includes today's regular weekly auction of new three- and six-month bills and an auction of four-week bills tomorrow.

At the close of the New York cash market on Friday, the rate on the outstanding three-month bill was 4.97 percent. The rate on the six-month issue was 5.03 percent, and the rate on the four-week issue was 4.89 percent.
The Treasury's schedule of financing this week includes today's regular weekly auction of new three- and six-month bills and an auction of four-week bills tomorrow.

At the close of the New York cash market on Friday, the rate on the outstanding three-month bill was 4.97 percent. The rate on the six-month issue was 5.03 percent, and the rate on the four-week issue was 4.89 percent.
The following tax-exempt fixed-income issues are scheduled for pricing this week:
TAX EXEMPT
WEDNESDAY
University of Maryland, $75.5 million of revenue bonds. Competitive.
ONE DAY DURING THE WEEK Bay Area Toll Authority, Oakland, Calif., $309 million of debt securities. Citigroup.
California Health Facilities Financing Authority, $775 million of financing authority revenue bonds, series 2007A for Sutter Health. Morgan Stanley.
California Housing Finance Agency, $270 million of home mortgage revenue bonds, series 2007D and E. Goldman Sachs.
Connecticut, $400 million of general obligation bonds. Merrill Lynch.
Denton, Tex., Independent School District, $79.1 million of unlimited tax school building debt securities. Bank of America.
Fontana Unified School District, Fontana, Calif., $50 million of certificates of participation debt securities. RBC Capital Markets.
Geisinger Authority, Danville, Pa., $120 million of debt securities. JPMorgan.
Pasadena, Tex., Independent School District, $71 million of debt securities. Bear Stearns.
Kentucky Housing Corporation, $75 million of debt securities. Merrill Lynch.
Little Rock, Ark., $64.9 million of sewer construction revenue bonds. Morgan Keegan.
Loudoun County, Va., Sanitation Authority, $75 million of debt securities. Merrill Lynch.
Maine Municipal Bond Bank, $111.2 million of debt securities. UBS.
Miami-Dade County, Fla., Public Schools, $330 million of certificates of participation debt securities. Citigroup.
Missouri Housing Development Commission, $100 million of single family mortgage revenue bonds. George K. Baum.
Montana Board of Housing, $83.1 million of single family mortgage revenue bonds. UBS.
Osceola County, Fla., School District, $60 million of certificates of participation debt securities. Citigroup.
Paulding County, Ga., $65 million of debt securities for the courthouse and government complex. Morgan Keegan.
Philadelphia, $244.6 million of gas works revenue bonds. Goldman Sachs.
Philadelphia School District, $150 million of debt securities. Siebert Brandford Shank.
Sacramento County, Calif., Water Agency, $400 million of debt securities. Bear Stearns.Seneca Nation of Indians, $160 million of debt securities. Merrill Lynch.
Tarrant County, Tex., Cultural Education Facilities Finance Corporation, $595.6 million of system refunding revenue bonds, series 2007A. Morgan Stanley.
Tyler, Tex., Health Facilities Development Authority, $85 million of debt securities. Merrill Lynch.
Virginia Tobacco Settlement Foundation, $1.2 billion in debt securities. Bear Stearns.
